Class LazyHexList

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<HexRow>
java.util.AbstractList<HexRow>
dev.bjdelacruz.hexeditor.services.LazyHexList
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<HexRow>, Collection<HexRow>, List<HexRow>, SequencedCollection<HexRow>
public class LazyHexList extends AbstractList<HexRow>
LazyHexList is a memory-efficient implementation of an AbstractList that provides random access to chucks of a file.

This class lazily loads and manages file chunks without reading the entire file into memory, making it suitable for working with very large files. Each chunk is represented by a HexRow, which contains the hexadecimal and ASCII representations of the data.

Key Features:

  • Lazy Loading: File contents are loaded only when accessed, reducing memory usage.
  • Read and Write Operations: Supports modification of the file through methods such as set(int, HexRow) and add(int, HexRow).
  • Supports Arbitrary File Sizes: Optimized for handling files larger than available memory up to MAX_LENGTH or approximately 34 GB.

Usage:

LazyHexList operates on a file, where each HexRow corresponds to a chunk of bytes.

For insertions, the number of bytes must be a multiple of AppConstants.CHUNK_SIZE, except when appending bytes to the end of the file. Bytes appended to the end of the file can be of any length. 

 
 var hexList = new LazyHexList("path/to/large/file.dat");

 // Access a specific row
 var row = hexList.get(2);
 System.out.println(row.hexData());
 System.out.println(row.asciiData());

 // Modify a row
 hexList.set(1, new HexRow(16, "AA BB CC DD EE FF 00 11 22 33 44 55 66 77 88 99",
     "........\"3DUfw.."));

 // Add a new row to the end of the file
 hexList.add(new HexRow(32, "01 23 45 67 89 AB CD EF", ".#Eg...."));

Concurrency:

This class is not thread-safe. External synchronization is required if accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

File Format Requirements:

  • The file can be opened in read/write mode.
  • The last row may be shorter than the specified chunk size.

Implementation Details:

LazyHexList performs read and write operations using a RandomAccessFile. It calculates the file offsets dynamically for each operation to ensure data consistency.

Limitations:

  • Relies on file system I/O for data access, which may impact performance for frequent random access operations.
  • Cannot handle files that are concurrently modified outside this class.
  • Because an AbstractList only supports indexes that are signed 32-bit integers, the maximum file size is limited to MAX_LENGTH.

  • Field Details

    • MAX_LENGTH

      public static final long MAX_LENGTH
      The maximum file size supported by the application (approximately 34 GB).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • LazyHexList

      public LazyHexList(File f)
      Creates a new instance of a LazyHexList. The given file is opened for random read/write access, and the number of rows, each containing a chunk of data, is calculated. The index of the last byte in the file is calculated so that new data can be appended to the end of it.
      Parameters:
      f - The file to open for read/write access.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the file does not exist.
      dev.bjdelacruz.hexeditor.services.LazyHexList.FileTooLargeException - If the file exceeds MAX_LENGTH or approximately 34 GB.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of rows of size AppConstants.CHUNK_SIZE or fewer (which may be the case for the last row) in the file. The number of rows will always be less than Integer.MAX_VALUE because MAX_LENGTH (maximum file size supported by the application) divided by AppConstants.CHUNK_SIZE is less than Integer.MAX_VALUE.
      Specified by:
      size in interface Collection<HexRow>
      Specified by:
      size in interface List<HexRow>
      Specified by:
      size in class AbstractCollection<HexRow>
      Returns:
      The number of rows of size AppConstants.CHUNK_SIZE or fewer in the file.

    • longToHex

      public static String longToHex(long value)
      Converts the given long value to a hexadecimal string with uppercase letters for A-F.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A hexadecimal string representation of the given long value.

    • getLastByteIndex

      public long getLastByteIndex()
      Returns the index of the last byte in the file, which is one less than the number of bytes in the file.
      Returns:
      The index of the last byte in the file.
